Assessment.QuestionText: Which of these statements about the <font face="courier new">Timer</font> component are true and which statements are false?

Options.Option: The <font face="courier new">Timer</font> component does not provide with the explicit functionality to stop the passage of time once it has started.
The <font face="courier new">Start()</font> method starts the <font face="courier new">Timer</font> component.
The <font face="courier new">Interval</font> property supports only a maximum interval of 64,766 milliseconds.
The <font face="courier new">Enabled</font> property indicates whether the <font face="courier new">Timer</font> component is running.
The <font face="courier new">Timer</font> component raises the <font face="courier new">Tick</font> event before the specified interval has been elapsed.

Assessment.CorrectFeedback: Yes, that's correct! You get one point for your response.
Assessment.incorrectFeedback: No, that's incorrect. The correct selections are: (A)-(False), (B)–(True), (C)–(False), (D)–(True), and (E)-(False).
